canDo: I can order food and drinks at a restaurant and make requests.

grammar.point: Would like, could/can for requests, countable/uncountable nouns

rules.title: Would like for polite requests
rules.explanation: Use 'would like' (= 'd like) to politely say what you want. More polite than 'want'.
examples: Would you like anything to drink?
rules.koreanTip: 'I want'보다 'I'd like'가 훨씬 공손해요. 식당에서는 항상 'I'd like'를 쓰세요.

rules.title: Could/Can I have for ordering
rules.explanation: Use 'Could I have...?' or 'Can I have...?' to ask for something politely.
examples: Could I have the menu, please?
rules.koreanTip: 'Could I have'가 'Can I have'보다 더 공손해요.

rules.title: Some/Any with food items
rules.explanation: Use 'some' in positive sentences and requests, 'any' in questions and negatives.
examples: Do you have any vegetarian options?
rules.koreanTip: 'some'은 긍정문과 부탁할 때, 'any'는 의문문과 부정문에 써요. 단, 주문할 때는 'some'을 써요!

exercises.question: I ___ a glass of orange juice, please.
exercises.explanation: 'Would like' ('d like) is the polite way to order in a restaurant.

exercises.question: ___ I have the menu, please?
exercises.explanation: 'Could I have...?' is a polite way to ask for something.

exercises.question: Which is the most polite way to order?
exercises.explanation: 'I'd like... please' is the most polite form.

words.meaning: a small dish before the main course
examples: The soup is a good appetizer.
words.koreanTip: 메인 요리 전에 먹는 작은 요리. 영국에서는 'starter'라고도 해요.

words.meaning: the biggest dish of a meal
examples: For the main course, I'll have the steak.
The main courses are on page two.

words.meaning: a document showing how much to pay
examples: Could we have the bill, please?
words.koreanTip: 미국에서는 'check'라고도 해요. 'Can I have the check?'

examples: A 15-20% tip is standard in the US.
words.koreanTip: 미국에서는 15-20% 팁이 일반적이에요. 한국과 달리 필수예요!

words.meaning: an arrangement to have a table saved
examples: I'd like to make a reservation for 7 PM.

reading.title: A Dinner Out
reading.passage: Last Saturday, my wife and I went to an Italian restaurant downtown. We had made a reservation for 7 PM. When we arrived, the waiter showed us to our table and gave us the menus. For appetizers, we ordered garlic bread and a salad. My wife chose the seafood pasta for her main course, and I had the pizza. The food was delicious! For dessert, we shared a slice of tiramisu. When we were ready to leave, I asked for the bill. The total was $85, so I left a $17 tip. It was a wonderful evening, and we'll definitely go back.

listening.title: Ordering at a Restaurant
listening.script: Good evening. Do you have a reservation? Yes, the name is Kim. For two people. Ah yes, right this way. Here's your table. Can I get you something to drink? I'll have a glass of red wine, please. And I'd like a sparkling water. Certainly. Are you ready to order, or do you need more time? We're ready. I'd like the grilled salmon with vegetables. And I'll have the beef steak, medium rare please. Excellent choices. I'll bring your drinks shortly.

exercises.question: What does the first person order to drink?
exercises.explanation: The speaker says 'I'll have a glass of red wine, please.'

exercises.question: The steak should be cooked ___.
exercises.explanation: The speaker says 'I'll have the beef steak, medium rare please.'

template.prompt: Write a restaurant dialogue using the template.
template.template:
Waiter: Good evening. What would you like to drink?
Customer: I'd like [DRINK], please.
Waiter: Are you ready to order?
Customer: Yes. For the appetizer, I'll have [APPETIZER]. And for the main course, I'd like [MAIN].
Waiter: Excellent choice. Anything for dessert?
Customer: [DESSERT_RESPONSE].

slots.name: DESSERT_RESPONSE
slots.hint: Yes, I'd like... / No, thank you

template.correctExample:
Waiter: Good evening. What would you like to drink?
Customer: I'd like a glass of iced tea, please.
Waiter: Are you ready to order?
Customer: Yes. For the appetizer, I'll have the soup of the day. And for the main course, I'd like the grilled chicken.
Waiter: Excellent choice. Anything for dessert?
Customer: Yes, I'd like a slice of chocolate cake.

koreanErrors.explanation: 'I want' sounds too direct in a restaurant. Use 'I'd like' for politeness.
koreanErrors.tip: 식당에서 'I want'는 너무 직접적이에요. 'I'd like'가 더 공손해요.

koreanErrors.correctForm: Could I have the bill, please?
koreanErrors.explanation: 'Give me' sounds rude. Use 'Could I have' to be polite.
koreanErrors.tip: 'Give me'는 명령조라 무례하게 들려요. 'Could I have'를 쓰세요.
